description: From New Latin abūlia, from Ancient Greek ἀβουλία (aboulía, “irresolution”), from ἀ- (a-, “without”) + βουλή (boulḗ, “will”).

entries.meaning: (psychiatry) Absence of willpower or decisiveness, especially as a symptom of mental illness. [from 19th c.]
examples: He felt without volition, plunged into a state of aboulia.
